comments.creator: paul.biggar@gmail.com
comments.text:
We need a script which:

1) gets a list of email addresses of people who have filled out the form in http://mozilla.org/contribute
2) checks if they have created bugzilla account.


It should be straightforward to download a mailbox file from the contribute@mozilla.org mailing list (though that list might not be public, so ask davidwboswell for access). No doubt there is a python library to parse mbox files. It should be possible to use Gerv's bzapi to check if an email address has created an account (and possibly compare the date of the email to the date of account creation to find out which came first).
comments.author: paul.biggar@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
We need a script which:

1) gets a list of email addresses of people who have filled out the form in http://mozilla.org/contribute
2) checks if they have created bugzilla account.


It should be straightforward to download a mailbox file from the contribute@mozilla.org mailing list (though that list might not be public, so ask davidwboswell for access). No doubt there is a python library to parse mbox files. It should be possible to use Gerv's bzapi to check if an email address has created an account (and possibly compare the date of the email to the date of account creation to find out which came first).

comments.author: davidwboswell@yahoo.com
comments.text:
Happy to help with this if anyone needs access.

Also for background, I manually checked some coding inquiries and did see some corresponding Bugzilla activity (around 1 out of 10 inquiries).  Would be great to be able to automate that.
comments.creator: davidwboswell@yahoo.com
